metadata.title: The Wonder Wok Cookbook · Healthy and Delicious Wok Recipes to Make like a Chef
metadata.author: Davis, Eric
metadata.description:
If you love Asian cuisine, you certainly love wok meals, as cooking in the wok is an essential part of Asian culinary traditions. From China to Indonesia, wok has been one of the main cooking utensils for centuries, offering comfort foods and exquisite meals that fondle our taste buds and mesmerize us with their intense flavor combinations.   
The major peculiarity and benefit of using the wok in your everyday meal preparation is that it takes around 10 minutes to prepare a complete meal, as due to its spherical shape, products are cooked in the wok in a matter of minutes, be it meat, seafood or vegetables.   
So if you are willing to spend minimum time in the kitchen to prepare your meals, then wok is a winner here as wok recipes are simple to prepare in almost no time and suit perfectly for your busy schedule. Wok cooking is also a healthy way of enjoying restaurant-like meals at home.   
This cookbook unveils the finest collection of 25 wok recipes to be prepared from your favorite meats (chicken, pork, beef, lamb, duck, etc.), fish & seafood, vegetables and spices.   
And I hope you will enjoy these impeccable easy and quick wok recipes, and make them your family staples.

chapters.title: Chapter 5
chapters.content: Introduction If you love Asian cuisine, you certainly love wok meals, as cooking in wok is an essential part of Asian culinary traditions. From China to Indonesia, wok has been one of the main cooking utensils for centuries, offering comfort foods and exquisite meals that fondle our taste buds and mesmerize us with their intense flavor combinations. The major peculiarity and benefit of using wok in your everyday meal preparation is that it takes around 10 minutes to prepare a complete meal, as due to its spherical shape, products are cooked in wok in a matter of minutes, be it meat, seafood or vegetables. And no matter if you opt for a traditional cast iron wok or modern carbon steel model, both would offer the same benefits of fast and eventually healthy cooking, as wok needs just a drop of oil in contrast to traditional frying. Taking care of your wok is not so difficult as well. If you are using a cast iron wok, you should simply brush it with some oil before heating. And after you are done with cooking, it is recommended to let it cool down, then clean it under flowing water with a damp cloth to discard the remaining bits of foods and then just temper it over high flame to dry all the water to avoid corrosion. And in case you are using a carbon steel wok, simply wash it like a usual pan after cooking and cooling down and pat dry it using a kitchen towel. In case your wok is a non-stick one, avoid using aluminum spatulas, opting for wooden ones. If you are willing to spend minimum time in the kitchen to prepare your meals, then wok is a winner here as wok recipes are simple to prepare in almost no time and suit perfectly for your busy schedule. Wok cooking is also a healthy way of enjoying restaurant-like meals at home. Unlike restaurant meals, homemade wok meals are less salty and fatty and include healthier oils, like canola, peanut and olive oil. This cookbook unveils the finest collection of 25 wok recipes to be prepared from your favorite meats (chicken, pork, beef, lamb, duck, etc.), fish & seafood, vegetables and spices. With wok, you don’t need to order your favorite meals from local restaurants as you can simply prepare them at home with our easy-to-follow instructions. The recipes covered in the book offer simple steps to prepare them and are suitable for both beginners as well as kitchen experts; you can effortlessly prepare your favorite meat-based as well as vegetarian meals for your family. Start making healthy wok recipes and enjoy aromatic wok meals prepared from the freshest ingredients in the comfort of your kitchen.

chapters.title: Garlic Broccoli Shrimp
chapters.content: Garlic Broccoli Shrimp Prep Time: 20-25 min. Serves: 4-5 Ingredients: 2 pounds of shrimp, peeled and deveined 1 ½ tbsp. of sesame oil 4 cups of broccoli, cut in florets For the brown sauce: 1 ½ tbsp. sriracha sauce 1 tbsp. ginger, grated 5 cloves garlic, minced 1 tbsp. brown sugar 4 tbsp. soy sauce, low-sodium 1 tbsp. orange juice 2 tsp. sesame oil 1 tsp. cornstarch Directions: - In a mixing bowl, combine all of the ingredients for the brown sauce. Whisk well. - Heat up your wok over medium to high heat. - Add in 1 ½ tbs. of sesame oil and heat it, and then add the shrimp in. - Cook for 3 minutes or until the shrimp is light pink; add the broccoli florets in. - Continue cooking for 2-3 minutes, stirring constantly. - Pour in the brown sauce and stir well to coat evenly. - Cook for another 2 minutes or until the sauce thickens. - Serve immediately. Nutritional Value (per serving): 356Kcal, (fats – 12gr, carbs – 12gr, protein – 50gr, fiber – 1gr)

chapters.title: Creamy Salmon Leeks
chapters.content: Creamy Salmon Leeks Prep Time: 12-15 min. Serves: 4 Ingredients: 1 rеd рерреr, dеsееdеd аnd dісеd 1 gаrlіс сlоvе, сrushеd 1 tbsp. cooking оіl 1/2 роund lееks, trіmmеd аnd slісеd 1 роund sаlmоn fіllеts, сubеd 1/2 сuр whірріng сrеаm 1/3 іnсh gіngеr, рееlеd аnd grаtеd 1/2 сuр сосоnut mіlk Pаrslеу as needed Directions: - Неаt thе оіl іn your wоk оvеr mеdіum-hіgh heat - Аdd thе lееks, рерреr, gаrlіс, аnd gіngеr. - Ѕаuté fоr 2-3 mіnutes and season as needed. - Аdd thе sаlmоn, сrеаm, аnd mіlk; combine well and stir-fry fоr 4-5 mіnutes untіl thе fіsh іs сооkеd thrоugh. Keep stiring constantly - Top wіth the раrslеу and serve warm! Nutritional Value (per serving): 342Kcal, (fats – 18gr, carbs – 16gr, protein – 26gr, fiber – 4gr)

chapters.title: Spiced Jalapeno Shrimp
chapters.content: Spiced Jalapeno Shrimp Prep Time: 12-15 min. Serves: 4 Ingredients: 1/4 tsp. sаlt 1/4 tsp. sugаr 1/4 tsp. сhіnеsе fіvе-sрісе роwdеr 1/4 tsp. grоund рерреr 2 tbsp. gіngеr, mіnсеd 3 gаrlіс сlоvеs, mіnсеd 1 1/2 роunds lаrgе shrіmрs, рееlеd аnd dеvеіnеd 1 grееn јаlареñо, sееdеd аnd mіnсеd 2 tbsp. mіrіn 4 tbsp. соrn оіl 1/4 сuр соrnstаrсh Directions: - Іn а mixing bоwl, mix tоgеthеr thе sugаr, Chinese sрісе роwdеr, pepper, and salt. - Wаrm up your wоk оvеr a hіgh stove flame. - Add 2 tbsp. оf thе оіl and heat it. - Sрrеаd thе соrnstаrсh оn а рlаtе and coat the shrimps evenly. - Аdd thе shrіmрs tо thе wоk іn а sіnglе lауеr аnd sеаr for аbоut 1 mіnutе реr sіdе to make them opaque. - Trаnsfеr thе shrіmрs tо а bоwl. - In the wok, add thе gіngеr, gаrlіс, аnd сhіlі; cook for аbоut 10 seconds stirring constantly. - Аdd thе sрісе mіхturе аnd mіrіn; then add the shrimps back and combine. - Cook everything for about 15 tо 20 sесоnds. - Тrаnsfеr the shrimps tо а рlаttеr аnd sеrvе wіth a dірріng sаuсе of your choice. Nutritional Value (per serving): 288Kcal, (fats – 12gr, carbs – 7gr, protein – 21gr, fiber – 3gr)

chapters.title: Tilapia Mushroom Veggie Treat
chapters.content: Tilapia Mushroom Veggie Treat Prep Time: 2 hours 35-40 min. Serves: 4 Ingredients: 2 cloves garlic, minced 1 cup mushrooms of your choice such as dry wood mushrooms 1 small onion, cut in thin slices ¼ cup shaoxing wine 2 tsp. cornstarch 1 long hot green pepper, cut in chunks 2 scallions, sliced 3 tbsp. soy sauce 2 tilapia fillets, cut in small chunks ½ cup green peas ½ tsp. sesame oil 1 red bell pepper, sliced 1-inch piece of ginger, sliced Vegetable oil as needed ⅓ cup water Ground white pepper as needed Directions: - Soak the mushrooms in cold water for 2 hours; drain, chop, and set aside, - In a zip lock bag, thoroughly combine the cornstarch, sesame oil, wine, white pepper, tilapia chunks, and soy sauce. - Zip the bag and allow marinating for 15-30 minutes. - In a wok, add 3 tbsp. oil and heat over medium-high flame. - Sauté the ginger for 1 minute until softened, and then sauté the garlic for another 30 seconds. - Add the onion and stir-fry for 2 minutes. - Slightly increase the heat, add the pepper and sauté for 1 minute; then add and cook the mushrooms and green peas for about 2 minutes. - Add the fish, marinade liquid, and water; cook the mix for about 5 minutes until the fish turns opaque, stirring constantly to avoid burning and sticking to the sides of your wok. - Add the scallions and combine; cook for 2 more minutes. - Serve warm! Nutritional Value (per serving): 207Kcal, (fats – 10gr, carbs – 2gr, protein – 26gr, fiber – 3gr)

chapters.title: Chapter 2: Hearty Poultry Recipes
chapters.content: Chapter 2: Hearty Poultry Recipes Creamy Corn Chicken Lunch Prep Time: 35-40 min. Serves: 5-6 Ingredients: 1/4 cup water 2 cups chicken broth 1/2 pound skinless, boneless chicken breast meat, diced 1 tbsp. sherry 2 tsp. soy sauce 1/4 tsp. salt 1 (14.75 oz.) can corn 2 egg whites 2 tbsp. cornstarch 4 slices bacon, cooked and crispy Directions: - Gently crumble the bacon - In a mixing bowl, thoroughly combine the chicken, egg whites, sherry, and salt to mix well with each other. - Mix the corn in. - In a wok, heat the soy sauce and broth over medium-high stove flame. - Add the chicken mix and bring to a boil. - Turn down the heat to medium and fry for 4-5 minutes; stirring in between. - Combine some cornstarch and water in a bowl. -Pour the cornstarch to the wok, mix and cook while stirring for 3 minutes until the sauce is thick enough to your liking. - Add the bacon and serve warm with a bed of brown or white rice. Nutritional Value (per serving): 207Kcal, (fats – 10gr, carbs – 2gr, protein – 26gr, fiber – 3gr)

chapters.title: Chili Honey Chicken Wings
chapters.content: Chili Honey Chicken Wings Prep Time: 50-55 min. Serves: 3-4 Ingredients: 1 tsp. crushed ginger 1 tbsp. peanut oil 2 tbsp. soy sauce 6 tbsp. honey ½ tbsp. fish sauce 16 chicken wings 3 cloves garlic, minced 3 tbsp. chili & garlic sauce 1 scallion, chopped Directions: - Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. - Add the wings on a baking sheet and bake for 15 minutes. - In a mixing bowl, thoroughly combine the wings, ginger and garlic to mix well with each other. - In your wok, heat the oil over medium-high flame - Add the chicken and cook for 3 minutes to crisp them. - Turn the heat down to medium; add in the fish sauce, soy sauce, honey, and garlic sauce. - Stir well and cook for 1 minute. - Toss well and serve with some scallions on top. Nutritional Value (per serving of 4 wings): 420Kcal, (fats – 10gr, carbs – 11gr, protein – 12gr, fiber – 0gr)

chapters.title: Coconut Rice Chicken
chapters.content: Coconut Rice Chicken Prep Time: 35-40 min. Serves: 4-5 Ingredients: 2 tbsp. ginger root, grated 1 3/4 cup coconut milk 1 1/2 pounds skinless, boneless chicken breast halves, cut in small cubes 2 limes, zested and juiced 1 tbsp. sesame oil 1 tbsp. honey 1/2 tsp white sugar 1 cup jasmine rice 1/4 cup flaked coconut, sweetened Directions: - In a mixing bowl, thoroughly combine the ginger, chicken meat, lime zest, and lime juice to mix well with each other. - Cover the bowl and allow marinating for 30 minutes in the fridge. - In a saucepan; mix the sugar and milk. - Boil the mix and add the jasmine rice. - Set the flame to low, cover the pan and cook for 20-22 minutes. - In your wok, heat some oil over medium-high flame. - Add in the chicken and the marinating liquids. Cook for 5 minutes stirring constantly. - Add the honey; turn off the heat and add in the coconut flakes on top. - Serve with the cooked rice. Nutritional Value (per serving): 278 Kcal, (fats – 9gr, carbs – 28gr, protein – 21gr, fiber – 2gr)

chapters.title: Peanut Chicken Fry
chapters.content: Peanut Chicken Fry Prep Time: 35 min. Serves: 5-6 Ingredients: 1 red bell pepper, chopped 1 1/2 cup chicken broth 2 tsp soy sauce 1 tbsp. peanut oil 1 pound skinless, boneless chicken breast halves, cut in bite-size pieces 1 (1-inch) piece ginger root, peeled and chopped 1 tbsp. cornstarch 1 tbsp. sugar 1 clove garlic, minced 1/4 tsp. cayenne pepper, ground 1 bunch green onions, chopped 1 bunch cilantro, chopped 2 cups dry roasted peanuts, chopped Directions: - In a mixing bowl, thoroughly combine the broth, soy sauce, sugar, garlic, cayenne pepper, ginger, and cornstarch to mix well with each other. - In your wok, heat some oil over medium-high flame. - Add the chicken bites and cook for 5 minutes, stirring constantly. - Add the bell pepper and cook until tender. - Add the bowl mix, cilantro, and onions; combine well. - Stir-fry for 6 minutes until the sauce becomes thick. - Mix in the peanuts and give one last mix - Serve with rice noodles and enjoy. Nutritional Value (per serving): 307Kcal, (fats – 20gr, carbs – 11gr, protein – 23gr, fiber – 2gr)

chapters.title: Green Beans Turkey Lunch
chapters.content: Green Beans Turkey Lunch Prep Time: 25-30 min. Serves: 4-5 Ingredients: 5 tsp. peanut oil 1 cup chopped onion 1 1/2 pounds green beans, trimmed 1 tbsp. water 3/4 cup apple cider vinegar 1/4 tsp. liquid smoke flavoring 6 slices turkey bacon 3/4 cup brown sugar 1/2 tsp ground black pepper Directions: - In a large bowl, add the green beans and pour the water to cover the beans by about 1-2 inches on top of the beans. - Microwave the beans for 3-5 minutes or until soft. Drain all the liquid. - In your wok, heat 1 tbsp. oil over medium-high flame. - Add the onions; cook for 2 minutes to soften. - Set aside the onions and discard remaining oil from the wok. - Add the bacon to the dry wok and fry it until it is completely cooked for 5-6 minutes. - Set aside the bacon to dry out on a paper towel. - In the same wok, heat the remaining oil. - Add the liquid smoke flavoring, vinegar, and brown sugar. - Stir-fry for 1-2 minutes; add in the green beans and onions. - Cook everything for 3 more minutes. - Serve warm with some black pepper on top. Nutritional Value (per serving): 142Kcal, (fats –8gr, carbs – 18gr, protein – 5gr, fiber – 4gr)

chapters.title: Chapter 3: Joyful Meat Meals
chapters.content: Chapter 3: Joyful Meat Meals Chinese Style Pork Tofu Prep Time: 25-30 min. Serves: 4 Ingredients: ½ tsp. chili paste 1 clove garlic, minced 2 tbsp. peanut oil ½ sweet onion, chopped 2 tbsp. black bean sauce 14-pound lean ground pork ½ block tofu, cut in small cubes 1 tsp. ground peppercorns Directions: - In your wok, heat the oil over medium-high flame. - Add in the onion, chili paste, and garlic; cook for 1 minute. - Add the pork and stir well to mix. - Fry for 6-8 minutes or until brown, stirring constantly. - Turn the heat down to medium and add the tofu cubes and bean sauce. Stir gently to incorporate. - Continue stirring and frying for 4-5 minutes. - Remove from the heat. Sprinkle the peppercorns and green onions on top. - Serve warm. Nutritional Value (per serving): 245Kcal, (fats –12gr, carbs – 7gr, protein – 25gr, fiber – 2gr)

chapters.title: Lamb Leek Chili
chapters.content: Lamb Leek Chili Prep Time: 35-40 min. Serves: 4 Ingredients: 1 tsp. white sugar ½ pound lamb, thinly sliced 1 tbsp. peanut oil 2 tbsp. soy sauce 1 tsp. sesame oil 2 tsp. shaoxing wine 3 dried red chili 1 tsp. garlic, minced 2 tsp. ginger, minced 2 leeks, cut in thin strips 2 tsp. hoisin sauce 2 tsp. cornstarch 4 tbsp. water Directions: - In a mixing bowl, thoroughly combine the soy sauce, sugar, Shaoxing wine, and sesame oil to mix well with each other. - Add the lamb and toss well. - Cover and set aside to marinate for 30-40 minutes. - Take a wok, set it over high heat flame and pour some peanut oil. - Heat the oil and add the minced ginger and leeks. - Cook for 1 minute. - Add the red chilies and garlic; continue to cook for another minute. - Add in the lamb and gently stir to combine well. - Cook for 8-10 minutes or until cooked through, stirring frequently. - Mix in the water, hoisin sauce, and cornstarch. - Cook for 3 minutes or until thick in consistency. - Serve warm! Nutritional Value (per serving): 362Kcal, (fats –17gr, carbs – 20gr, protein – 31gr, fiber – 3gr)

chapters.title: Spiced Duck & Rice
chapters.content: Spiced Duck & Rice Prep Time: 4 hours 15-20 min. Serves: 4-5 Ingredients: 2 tbsp. rice wine vinegar ½ cup jasmine rice, cooked ½ cup black tea leaves (optional) 2 tbs. Chinese five spice 3 duck breasts, skinless Black pepper and salt as needed ½ cup brown sugar 1 lemon rind Directions: - Season the duck with the five spice, pepper and salt. - Transfer into a Ziploc bag and pour in the vinegar. - Toss well; seal the bag and transfer to the fridge to marinate for 4 hours. - In a mixing bowl, thoroughly combine the rice, black tea leaves, sugar, and fresh lemon rind to mix well with each other. - Line the bottom of your wok with aluminum foil sheets. - Add in the rice mix and spread evenly. - Arrange a wire rack over the rice mix in the wok. - Place the duck on the wire rack. - Fold the foil to cover the duck and - Cover the wok with a lid. - Smoke for 8-10 minutes over medium heat. - Remove from the heat and continue to smoke for 2-3 minutes. - Serve warm! Nutritional Value (per serving): 357Kcal, (fats –11gr, carbs – 4gr, protein – 12gr, fiber – 3gr)

chapters.title: Hoisin Sweet Beef
chapters.content: Hoisin Sweet Beef Prep Time: 25-30 min. Serves: 5-6 Ingredients: 2 tbsp. hoisin sauce 1/ 3 cup dark brown sugar 1 cup soy sauce ¾ cup water 1 ½ tbsp. peanut oil 1 tsp. ginger, minced 2 pounds flank steak, cut to thin strips ¼ cup cornstarch 2 tbsp. garlic, minced 4 scallions, cut in small pieces Sesame seeds for garnishing Directions: - In a mixing bowl, thoroughly combine the soy sauce, water, sugar and hoisin sauce. - Stir well to mix. Set aside. - In another bowl, add the steak and cornstarch. - Toss well and set aside for 8-10 minutes. - In your wok, heat the peanut oil over medium-high flame. - Add the ginger and garlic; cook for 30-40 seconds to soften. - Add the steak; stir-fry for 2-3 minutes. - Remove and transfer to a plate. - Add the brown sugar sauce in the wok. - Add back the steak and toss well to coat evenly; cook for 1-2 minutes. - Add in the scallions, mix well. Transfer to a serving platter, sprinkle sesame seeds and serve warm. Nutritional Value (per serving): 277Kcal, (fats –9gr, carbs – 20gr, protein – 29gr, fiber – 3gr)

chapters.title: Coleslaw Pork Tortillas
chapters.content: Coleslaw Pork Tortillas Prep Time: 15 min. Serves: 4-5 Ingredients: 1 pound pork tenderloin, cut in thin strips 3 cloves garlic, minced 2 tbsp. peanut oil 2 tsp. sesame oil, lightly toasted 10 oz. coleslaw mixture 4 tbsp. hoisin sauce 6 scallions, sliced thinly 1 cup carrots, shredded 1 tbsp. soy sauce 10 flour tortillas Directions: - In your wok, heat the peanut oil over medium-high flame - Add the scallions, shredded carrots, and coleslaw mixture; fry for 2-3 minutes to soften. - Mix the hoisin and soy sauces in. - Turn the heat down to medium and add the pork. - Mix well and stir-fry for 5 minutes. - Serve warm with tortillas and sauces of your choice. Nutritional Value (per serving): 492Kcal, (fats –23gr, carbs – 38gr, protein – 31gr, fiber – 3gr)

chapters.title: Classic Garlic Broccoli Beef
chapters.content: Classic Garlic Broccoli Beef Prep Time: 15 min. Serves: 5-6 Ingredients: ¾ cup broccoli florets 1 tbsp. balsamic vinegar 1 pound beef, ground 1/4 cup yellow mustard 1 1/2 tsp. honey 1 1/2 tsp. paprika 1 tbs. garlic, minced 1 1/2 tsp. soy sauce 1/8 tsp. black pepper, ground Cooking oil as needed Directions: - Cook the broccoli florets in boiling water in a medium pan for 5-7 minutes. Set aside. - In your wok, heat some oil over medium-high flame - Add the beef; fry for 7 minutes to brown evenly, stirring constantly. - Add the mustard, paprika, vinegar, garlic, soy sauce, honey, and pepper. - Brown for 1 more minute. - Add the broccoli florets; mix gently and turn off the heat. - Transfer to serving plates and serve warm like it is or with brown rice! Nutritional Value (per serving): 492Kcal, (fats –23gr, carbs – 38gr, protein – 31gr, fiber – 3gr)

chapters.title: Veggie Hot Dog Rice
chapters.content: Veggie Hot Dog Rice Prep Time: 25-30 min. Serves: 4-5 Ingredients: 3 tbsp. cooking oil 2 eggs, beaten 3 cups steamed jasmine rice 3/4 cup peas ¾ cup carrots, diced 2 hot dog sausages, cut in quarters lengthwise & sliced 1 1/2 tbsp. soy sauce 1/8 tsp. pepper, ground 1/4 tsp. salt 4 green onions, thinly sliced Directions: - In your wok, heat 2 tbsp oil over medium-high flame. - Add the beaten eggs, salt, and pepper cook to evenly scramble and set aside. - In the wok, add the hot dog sausages and cook for 2 minutes. - Add the remaining oil, rice and stir for 2 minutes. - Add the peas and carrots, soy sauce, green onions, and scrambled eggs; stir-fry for about 2-3 minutes. - Serve warm with sausage on top! Nutritional Value (per serving): 585Kcal, (fats –19gr, carbs – 56gr, protein – 17gr, fiber – 6gr)

chapters.title: Chapter 4: Exotic Noodle Recipes
chapters.content: Chapter 4: Exotic Noodle Recipes Shrimp Egg Noodles Prep Time: 35-40 min. Serves: 4-5 Ingredients: 1 tbsp. soy sauce 1 tbsp. oyster sauce 1 tbsp. shaoxing wine 1 tsp. white sugar 1 onion, thinly sliced 1 clove garlic, minced 1 tsp. sesame oil 2 tbsp. peanut oil 1 red bell pepper, cut in strips 10 oz. rice noodles, soaked until softened and drained 1 scallion, sliced 1 cup shrimp, sliced thinly 2 eggs, beaten Directions: - In a mixing bowl, thoroughly combine the wine, white sugar, soy sauce, sesame oil, and oyster sauce. Set aside. - In your wok, heat the oil over medium-high flame. - Add the chopped onion, garlic, and red bell pepper; brown for 30 seconds. - Add the shrimp and fry for 1-2 minutes constantly stirring. - Add the eggs and cook for 1 more minute. - Add the drained noodles; toss and fry for 2 minutes. - Add the sauce; toss and cook for 2 minutes. - Add the scallions and cook for 1 minute. - Serve warm! Nutritional Value (per serving): 184Kcal, (fats –12gr, carbs – 11gr, protein – 12gr, fiber – 6gr)

chapters.title: Vegetarian Mushroom Noodles
chapters.content: Vegetarian Mushroom Noodles Prep Time: 30-35 min. Serves: 4-5 Ingredients: 1 tsp. sesame oil 1 tsp. chili sauce 1 tbsp. peanut oil 2 tbsp. soy sauce 2 tsp. white sugar 2 cloves garlic, minced ¼ cup carrots, shredded ½ cup snow peas 2 scallions, cut in small pieces ½ pound lo-mein noodles 1 ½ cups cremini mushrooms, thinly sliced 1 julienned red bell pepper Directions: - Cook the noodles for 8-10 minutes in salted water in a pot; drain and set aside. - In a mixing bowl, thoroughly combine the soy sauce, white sugar, sesame oil, and chili sauce. Set aside. - In your wok, heat the oil over medium-high flame. - Add the garlic, mushrooms, bell pepper, and carrots. Stir well to mix. - Cook for 3-5 minutes or until the mushrooms turn soft. - Add the peas and scallions. - Stir well; cook for another 2-3 minutes. - Mix in the noodles and sauce. Toss well until evenly coated. - Cook for 1 more minute and serve warm! Nutritional Value (per serving): 376Kcal, (fats –13gr, carbs – 36gr, protein – 15gr, fiber – 7gr)

chapters.title: Pancetta Peas Noodles
chapters.content: Pancetta Peas Noodles Prep Time: 18-20 min. Serves: 4-5 Ingredients: 1/2 cup grated parmesan 1 tbsp. olive oil 3 oz. pack ramen noodles (flavor packet discarded) 3 cups low-sodium chicken broth 1 tbsp. butter 1 medium onion, chopped 1/4 tsp. salt 1/2 cup diced pancetta 10 oz. frozen peas 1/4 tsp. ground black pepper Directions: - In your wok, heat the oil over medium flame. - Add and cook the pancetta for 4-5 minutes, stirring occasionally. - Stir in the onion and salt; cook for 3-4 minutes, stirring in between. - Add the noodles and cook for 1 minute, stirring constantly. - Mix in the peas and broth; turn the heat to high and bring to a boil. - Cook for about 3 more minutes, stirring constantly. - Turn off the heat and stir in the butter, Parmesan, and pepper. - Serve warm! Nutritional Value (per serving): 558Kcal, (fats –6gr, carbs – 85gr, protein – 30gr, fiber – 6gr)

chapters.title: Broccoli Pineapple Pasta
chapters.content: Broccoli Pineapple Pasta Prep Time: 20-25 min. Serves: 7-8 Ingredients: 3 cups cooked chicken breasts, cut in strips 2 cups frozen sweet pepper stir-fry 1 cup broccoli florets, boiled 2/3 cup stir-fry sauce 2 cups pineapple chunks 2 tbsp. vegetable oil 1 pound linguine pasta Directions: - Take a pan and pour 4 cups of water, boil the water and add the chicken strips. Boil for 10 minutes. - Cook the pasta in salted water, as per the package instructions. - Drain and set aside. - Heat your wok on a medium-high heat. - Pour the oil and heat it. Add the boiled broccoli florets and pineapples and cook for 2-3 minutes. - Stir in the pepper and fry for 2-3 more minutes; stirring in between. - Mix in the chicken and the sauce and brown for 2-3 minutes. - Serve warm with the cooked pasta. Nutritional Value (per serving): 368Kcal, (fats –8gr, carbs – 43gr, protein – 23gr, fiber – 5gr)

chapters.title: Chapter 5: Fresh Vegetarian Recipes
chapters.content: Chapter 5: Fresh Vegetarian Recipes Teriyaki Ginger Green Beans Prep Time: 15 min. Serves: 3-4 Ingredients: 1 tbsp. ginger root, minced 1 tbsp. garlic, minced 1/2 cup + 3 tbsp. peanut oil to fry 1 pound green beans, trimmed and cut in 2-inch pieces 1/2 tsp. white sugar 1 1/2 tsp. teriyaki sauce 1 pinch black pepper Directions: - In your wok; heat the peanut oil over medium-high flame. - Add the beans; cook the beans for 2-3 minutes to soften. Set aside. - Add more oil to the wok (about 3 tbsp) and heat it again. - Add the garlic and ginger; cook for 2 minutes to brown. - Add the beans back in the wok; mix the black pepper, sugar, and teriyaki. - Cook everything for about 1 minute and serve warm! Nutritional Value (per serving): 60Kcal, (fats –2gr, carbs – 9gr, protein – 3gr, fiber – 3gr)

chapters.title: Asian Soy Eggplants
chapters.content: Asian Soy Eggplants Prep Time: 35 min. Serves: 4-6 Ingredients: 4 tbsp. vegetable oil, divided 2 onions, thinly sliced 4 eggplants, cut in 1-inch cubes 2 tbsp. water 1 1/2 tbsp. oyster sauce 1 tbsp. chili garlic sauce 1 tbsp. minced garlic 2 tbsp. soy sauce 1 tsp. white sugar Ground black pepper as needed 1/2 tsp. sesame oil Directions: - In a mixing bowl, mix the pepper, soy sauce, sugar, water, chili sauce, and oyster sauce. - In your wok; heat 2 tbsp. of oil over medium-high flame. - Add the eggplants and stir-fry for 5-6 minutes. Set aside. - Add 2 more tbsp. oil in the wok. - Add the onions and garlic; cook for 1 minute to soften. - Pour the soy sauce mix and eggplants; simmer the mix over medium flame for 4-5 minutes, stirring constantly. - Add some sesame oil and cook for 1 more minute. - Top with some chopped scallions, if desired. Nutritional Value (per serving): 78Kcal, (fats –3gr, carbs – 1gr, protein – 2gr, fiber – 5gr)

chapters.title: Spiced Bean Mania
chapters.content: Spiced Bean Mania Prep Time: 35-40 min. Serves: 7-8 Ingredients: 2 cloves garlic, minced 2 tsp. ginger root, chopped 1 tsp. cayenne pepper 1 tsp. ground turmeric 2 tbsp. vegetable oil 2 onions, minced 1 tsp. ground coriander 2 (2 inch) sticks cinnamon, crushed 1 tsp. ground cumin Salt as needed 2 (15 oz.) cans garbanzo beans 1 cup cilantro, chopped Directions: - Heat your wok over medium heat, pour some oil to heat. - Add the onions; cook until they are tender for about 1-2 minutes. - Mix in the turmeric, salt, cayenne, garlic, cinnamon, cumin, ginger, and coriander. - Cook for 1-2 minutes; stirring in between. - Mix in the beans and liquid from the cans. - Cook the mixture, for 4-5 minutes, until the liquid is evaporated and the sauce is thick. - Top with cilantro and serve. Nutritional Value (per serving): 60Kcal, (fats –4gr, carbs – 8gr, protein – 4gr, fiber – 5gr)

chapters.title: Peanut Veggie Stir Fry
chapters.content: Peanut Veggie Stir Fry Prep Time: 10-15 min. Serves: 5-6 Ingredients: 2 tsp. garlic powder 2 tsp. peanut butter 2 tbsp. soy sauce 1 tbsp. brown sugar 2 tsp. olive oil 2 cups frozen vegetables mix (carrots, bell peppers, eggplants and etc) Directions: - In a mixing bowl, mix the peanut butter, say sauce, garlic powder, and sugar. - Take your wok and heat some oil in it over medium heat. - Add and stir-fry the veggies for 7-8 minutes. - Season the veggies with the soy sauce mix, toss well and fry for 1 more minute. - Serve warm! Nutritional Value (per serving): 176Kcal, (fats –6gr, carbs – 15gr, protein – 12gr, fiber – 6gr)

chapters.title: Mushroom Sprouts Rice
chapters.content: Mushroom Sprouts Rice Prep Time: 15-20 min. Serves: 3-4 Ingredients: 1 cup zucchini, shred to make matchsticks 1/2 (14 oz.) can bean sprouts, drained 2 tbsp. sesame oil 1 cup carrots, shred to make matchsticks 1 (4.5 oz.) can sliced mushrooms, drained 1/8 tsp. salt 2 tbsp. soy sauce 2 cups cooked rice 1/3 cup sliced green onions 1/4 tsp. ground black pepper 3 tsp. sweet red chili sauce Directions: - In your wok, stir-fry the zucchini and carrots in sesame oil for 5 minutes. - Add the mushrooms and sprouts. - Cook for 5 more minutes and add some salt. - Combine and remove the veggies from the wok. Set aside. - In the wok, add the pepper, soy sauce, and green onions. - Add the chili sauce and cook until the mix turns hot. - Pour the soy sauce mix over the veggies and stir well to combine. - Serve warm along with the cooked rice. Nutritional Value (per serving): 152Kcal, (fats –9gr, carbs – 16gr, protein – 12gr, fiber – 6gr)

chapters.title: Conclusion
chapters.content: Conclusion Wok is a healthy way of cooking and enjoying your favorite meals. It is quite easy to use and clean and takes less time of yours to invest in your kitchen chores. In addition, wok meals look pretty festive and exotic, so you can make these recipes for your special gatherings, holiday parties and formal get-to-gather events. Guests just love being served with delicious stir-fried dishes to fill their stomachs and hearts. I sincerely hope that the book has succeeded in its mission to give all the readers a truly versatile collection of wok recipes to easily prepare at home and enjoy these flavor-rich, healthy wok meals with your family and loved ones. Wok cooking is so popular due to the creative style of preparing and arranging the ingredients, as well as the flexibility and modifications. So don’t be afraid of culinary experiments, be creative and add your favorite ingredients to these recipes to make your own customized versions. Finally, if you have enjoyed the Wonder Wok Cookbook, I would appreciate it if you spend a few minutes of your valuable time to share your views and suggestion in a short review. Have a great time making these healthy wok recipes. Share more and bring more smiles. Best Regards, Eric Davis

chunks.title: Chapter 5
chunks.content: Introduction If you love Asian cuisine, you certainly love wok meals, as cooking in wok is an essential part of Asian culinary traditions. From China to Indonesia, wok has been one of the main cooking utensils for centuries, offering comfort foods and exquisite meals that fondle our taste buds and mesmerize us with their intense flavor combinations. The major peculiarity and benefit of using wok in your everyday meal preparation is that it takes around 10 minutes to prepare a complete meal, as due to its spherical shape, products are cooked in wok in a matter of minutes, be it meat, seafood or vegetables. And no matter if you opt for a traditional cast iron wok or modern carbon steel model, both would offer the same benefits of fast and eventually healthy cooking, as wok needs just a drop of oil in contrast to traditional frying. Taking care of your wok is not so difficult as well. If you are using a cast iron wok, you should simply brush it with some oil before heating. And after you are done with cooking, it is recommended to let it cool down, then clean it under flowing water with a damp cloth to discard the remaining bits of foods and then just temper it over high flame to dry all the water to avoid corrosion. And in case you are using a carbon steel wok, simply wash it like a usual pan after cooking and cooling down and pat dry it using a kitchen towel. In case your wok is a non-stick one, avoid using aluminum spatulas, opting for wooden ones. If you are willing to spend minimum time in the kitchen to prepare your meals, then wok is a winner here as wok recipes are simple to prepare in almost no time and suit perfectly for your busy schedule. Wok cooking is also a healthy way of enjoying restaurant-like meals at home. Unlike restaurant meals, homemade wok meals are less salty and fatty and include healthier oils, like canola, peanut and olive oil. This cookbook unveils the finest collection of 25 wok recipes to be prepared from your favorite meats (chicken, pork, beef, lamb, duck, etc.), fish & seafood, vegetables and spices. With wok, you don’t need to order your favorite meals from local restaurants as you can simply prepare them at home with our easy-to-follow instructions. The recipes covered in the book offer simple steps to prepare them and are suitable for both beginners as well as kitchen experts; you can effortlessly prepare your favorite meat-based as well as vegetarian meals for your family. Start making healthy wok recipes and enjoy aromatic wok meals prepared from the freshest ingredients in the comfort of your kitchen.

chunks.title: Garlic Broccoli Shrimp
chunks.content: Garlic Broccoli Shrimp Prep Time: 20-25 min. Serves: 4-5 Ingredients: 2 pounds of shrimp, peeled and deveined 1 ½ tbsp. of sesame oil 4 cups of broccoli, cut in florets For the brown sauce: 1 ½ tbsp. sriracha sauce 1 tbsp. ginger, grated 5 cloves garlic, minced 1 tbsp. brown sugar 4 tbsp. soy sauce, low-sodium 1 tbsp. orange juice 2 tsp. sesame oil 1 tsp. cornstarch Directions: - In a mixing bowl, combine all of the ingredients for the brown sauce. Whisk well. - Heat up your wok over medium to high heat. - Add in 1 ½ tbs. of sesame oil and heat it, and then add the shrimp in. - Cook for 3 minutes or until the shrimp is light pink; add the broccoli florets in. - Continue cooking for 2-3 minutes, stirring constantly. - Pour in the brown sauce and stir well to coat evenly. - Cook for another 2 minutes or until the sauce thickens. - Serve immediately. Nutritional Value (per serving): 356Kcal, (fats – 12gr, carbs – 12gr, protein – 50gr, fiber – 1gr)

chunks.title: Creamy Salmon Leeks
chunks.content: Creamy Salmon Leeks Prep Time: 12-15 min. Serves: 4 Ingredients: 1 rеd рерреr, dеsееdеd аnd dісеd 1 gаrlіс сlоvе, сrushеd 1 tbsp. cooking оіl 1/2 роund lееks, trіmmеd аnd slісеd 1 роund sаlmоn fіllеts, сubеd 1/2 сuр whірріng сrеаm 1/3 іnсh gіngеr, рееlеd аnd grаtеd 1/2 сuр сосоnut mіlk Pаrslеу as needed Directions: - Неаt thе оіl іn your wоk оvеr mеdіum-hіgh heat - Аdd thе lееks, рерреr, gаrlіс, аnd gіngеr. - Ѕаuté fоr 2-3 mіnutes and season as needed. - Аdd thе sаlmоn, сrеаm, аnd mіlk; combine well and stir-fry fоr 4-5 mіnutes untіl thе fіsh іs сооkеd thrоugh. Keep stiring constantly - Top wіth the раrslеу and serve warm! Nutritional Value (per serving): 342Kcal, (fats – 18gr, carbs – 16gr, protein – 26gr, fiber – 4gr)

chunks.title: Spiced Jalapeno Shrimp
chunks.content: Spiced Jalapeno Shrimp Prep Time: 12-15 min. Serves: 4 Ingredients: 1/4 tsp. sаlt 1/4 tsp. sugаr 1/4 tsp. сhіnеsе fіvе-sрісе роwdеr 1/4 tsp. grоund рерреr 2 tbsp. gіngеr, mіnсеd 3 gаrlіс сlоvеs, mіnсеd 1 1/2 роunds lаrgе shrіmрs, рееlеd аnd dеvеіnеd 1 grееn јаlареñо, sееdеd аnd mіnсеd 2 tbsp. mіrіn 4 tbsp. соrn оіl 1/4 сuр соrnstаrсh Directions: - Іn а mixing bоwl, mix tоgеthеr thе sugаr, Chinese sрісе роwdеr, pepper, and salt. - Wаrm up your wоk оvеr a hіgh stove flame. - Add 2 tbsp. оf thе оіl and heat it. - Sрrеаd thе соrnstаrсh оn а рlаtе and coat the shrimps evenly. - Аdd thе shrіmрs tо thе wоk іn а sіnglе lауеr аnd sеаr for аbоut 1 mіnutе реr sіdе to make them opaque. - Trаnsfеr thе shrіmрs tо а bоwl. - In the wok, add thе gіngеr, gаrlіс, аnd сhіlі; cook for аbоut 10 seconds stirring constantly. - Аdd thе sрісе mіхturе аnd mіrіn; then add the shrimps back and combine. - Cook everything for about 15 tо 20 sесоnds. - Тrаnsfеr the shrimps tо а рlаttеr аnd sеrvе wіth a dірріng sаuсе of your choice. Nutritional Value (per serving): 288Kcal, (fats – 12gr, carbs – 7gr, protein – 21gr, fiber – 3gr)

chunks.title: Tilapia Mushroom Veggie Treat
chunks.content: Tilapia Mushroom Veggie Treat Prep Time: 2 hours 35-40 min. Serves: 4 Ingredients: 2 cloves garlic, minced 1 cup mushrooms of your choice such as dry wood mushrooms 1 small onion, cut in thin slices ¼ cup shaoxing wine 2 tsp. cornstarch 1 long hot green pepper, cut in chunks 2 scallions, sliced 3 tbsp. soy sauce 2 tilapia fillets, cut in small chunks ½ cup green peas ½ tsp. sesame oil 1 red bell pepper, sliced 1-inch piece of ginger, sliced Vegetable oil as needed ⅓ cup water Ground white pepper as needed Directions: - Soak the mushrooms in cold water for 2 hours; drain, chop, and set aside, - In a zip lock bag, thoroughly combine the cornstarch, sesame oil, wine, white pepper, tilapia chunks, and soy sauce. - Zip the bag and allow marinating for 15-30 minutes. - In a wok, add 3 tbsp. oil and heat over medium-high flame. - Sauté the ginger for 1 minute until softened, and then sauté the garlic for another 30 seconds. - Add the onion and stir-fry for 2 minutes. - Slightly increase the heat, add the pepper and sauté for 1 minute; then add and cook the mushrooms and green peas for about 2 minutes. - Add the fish, marinade liquid, and water; cook the mix for about 5 minutes until the fish turns opaque, stirring constantly to avoid burning and sticking to the sides of your wok. - Add the scallions and combine; cook for 2 more minutes. - Serve warm! Nutritional Value (per serving): 207Kcal, (fats – 10gr, carbs – 2gr, protein – 26gr, fiber – 3gr)

chunks.title: Chapter 2: Hearty Poultry Recipes
chunks.content: Chapter 2: Hearty Poultry Recipes Creamy Corn Chicken Lunch Prep Time: 35-40 min. Serves: 5-6 Ingredients: 1/4 cup water 2 cups chicken broth 1/2 pound skinless, boneless chicken breast meat, diced 1 tbsp. sherry 2 tsp. soy sauce 1/4 tsp. salt 1 (14.75 oz.) can corn 2 egg whites 2 tbsp. cornstarch 4 slices bacon, cooked and crispy Directions: - Gently crumble the bacon - In a mixing bowl, thoroughly combine the chicken, egg whites, sherry, and salt to mix well with each other. - Mix the corn in. - In a wok, heat the soy sauce and broth over medium-high stove flame. - Add the chicken mix and bring to a boil. - Turn down the heat to medium and fry for 4-5 minutes; stirring in between. - Combine some cornstarch and water in a bowl. -Pour the cornstarch to the wok, mix and cook while stirring for 3 minutes until the sauce is thick enough to your liking. - Add the bacon and serve warm with a bed of brown or white rice. Nutritional Value (per serving): 207Kcal, (fats – 10gr, carbs – 2gr, protein – 26gr, fiber – 3gr)

chunks.title: Chili Honey Chicken Wings
chunks.content: Chili Honey Chicken Wings Prep Time: 50-55 min. Serves: 3-4 Ingredients: 1 tsp. crushed ginger 1 tbsp. peanut oil 2 tbsp. soy sauce 6 tbsp. honey ½ tbsp. fish sauce 16 chicken wings 3 cloves garlic, minced 3 tbsp. chili & garlic sauce 1 scallion, chopped Directions: - Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. - Add the wings on a baking sheet and bake for 15 minutes. - In a mixing bowl, thoroughly combine the wings, ginger and garlic to mix well with each other. - In your wok, heat the oil over medium-high flame - Add the chicken and cook for 3 minutes to crisp them. - Turn the heat down to medium; add in the fish sauce, soy sauce, honey, and garlic sauce. - Stir well and cook for 1 minute. - Toss well and serve with some scallions on top. Nutritional Value (per serving of 4 wings): 420Kcal, (fats – 10gr, carbs – 11gr, protein – 12gr, fiber – 0gr)

chunks.title: Coconut Rice Chicken
chunks.content: Coconut Rice Chicken Prep Time: 35-40 min. Serves: 4-5 Ingredients: 2 tbsp. ginger root, grated 1 3/4 cup coconut milk 1 1/2 pounds skinless, boneless chicken breast halves, cut in small cubes 2 limes, zested and juiced 1 tbsp. sesame oil 1 tbsp. honey 1/2 tsp white sugar 1 cup jasmine rice 1/4 cup flaked coconut, sweetened Directions: - In a mixing bowl, thoroughly combine the ginger, chicken meat, lime zest, and lime juice to mix well with each other. - Cover the bowl and allow marinating for 30 minutes in the fridge. - In a saucepan; mix the sugar and milk. - Boil the mix and add the jasmine rice. - Set the flame to low, cover the pan and cook for 20-22 minutes. - In your wok, heat some oil over medium-high flame. - Add in the chicken and the marinating liquids. Cook for 5 minutes stirring constantly. - Add the honey; turn off the heat and add in the coconut flakes on top. - Serve with the cooked rice. Nutritional Value (per serving): 278 Kcal, (fats – 9gr, carbs – 28gr, protein – 21gr, fiber – 2gr)

chunks.title: Peanut Chicken Fry
chunks.content: Peanut Chicken Fry Prep Time: 35 min. Serves: 5-6 Ingredients: 1 red bell pepper, chopped 1 1/2 cup chicken broth 2 tsp soy sauce 1 tbsp. peanut oil 1 pound skinless, boneless chicken breast halves, cut in bite-size pieces 1 (1-inch) piece ginger root, peeled and chopped 1 tbsp. cornstarch 1 tbsp. sugar 1 clove garlic, minced 1/4 tsp. cayenne pepper, ground 1 bunch green onions, chopped 1 bunch cilantro, chopped 2 cups dry roasted peanuts, chopped Directions: - In a mixing bowl, thoroughly combine the broth, soy sauce, sugar, garlic, cayenne pepper, ginger, and cornstarch to mix well with each other. - In your wok, heat some oil over medium-high flame. - Add the chicken bites and cook for 5 minutes, stirring constantly. - Add the bell pepper and cook until tender. - Add the bowl mix, cilantro, and onions; combine well. - Stir-fry for 6 minutes until the sauce becomes thick. - Mix in the peanuts and give one last mix - Serve with rice noodles and enjoy. Nutritional Value (per serving): 307Kcal, (fats – 20gr, carbs – 11gr, protein – 23gr, fiber – 2gr)

chunks.title: Green Beans Turkey Lunch
chunks.content: Green Beans Turkey Lunch Prep Time: 25-30 min. Serves: 4-5 Ingredients: 5 tsp. peanut oil 1 cup chopped onion 1 1/2 pounds green beans, trimmed 1 tbsp. water 3/4 cup apple cider vinegar 1/4 tsp. liquid smoke flavoring 6 slices turkey bacon 3/4 cup brown sugar 1/2 tsp ground black pepper Directions: - In a large bowl, add the green beans and pour the water to cover the beans by about 1-2 inches on top of the beans. - Microwave the beans for 3-5 minutes or until soft. Drain all the liquid. - In your wok, heat 1 tbsp. oil over medium-high flame. - Add the onions; cook for 2 minutes to soften. - Set aside the onions and discard remaining oil from the wok. - Add the bacon to the dry wok and fry it until it is completely cooked for 5-6 minutes. - Set aside the bacon to dry out on a paper towel. - In the same wok, heat the remaining oil. - Add the liquid smoke flavoring, vinegar, and brown sugar. - Stir-fry for 1-2 minutes; add in the green beans and onions. - Cook everything for 3 more minutes. - Serve warm with some black pepper on top. Nutritional Value (per serving): 142Kcal, (fats –8gr, carbs – 18gr, protein – 5gr, fiber – 4gr)

chunks.title: Chapter 3: Joyful Meat Meals
chunks.content: Chapter 3: Joyful Meat Meals Chinese Style Pork Tofu Prep Time: 25-30 min. Serves: 4 Ingredients: ½ tsp. chili paste 1 clove garlic, minced 2 tbsp. peanut oil ½ sweet onion, chopped 2 tbsp. black bean sauce 14-pound lean ground pork ½ block tofu, cut in small cubes 1 tsp. ground peppercorns Directions: - In your wok, heat the oil over medium-high flame. - Add in the onion, chili paste, and garlic; cook for 1 minute. - Add the pork and stir well to mix. - Fry for 6-8 minutes or until brown, stirring constantly. - Turn the heat down to medium and add the tofu cubes and bean sauce. Stir gently to incorporate. - Continue stirring and frying for 4-5 minutes. - Remove from the heat. Sprinkle the peppercorns and green onions on top. - Serve warm. Nutritional Value (per serving): 245Kcal, (fats –12gr, carbs – 7gr, protein – 25gr, fiber – 2gr)

chunks.title: Lamb Leek Chili
chunks.content: Lamb Leek Chili Prep Time: 35-40 min. Serves: 4 Ingredients: 1 tsp. white sugar ½ pound lamb, thinly sliced 1 tbsp. peanut oil 2 tbsp. soy sauce 1 tsp. sesame oil 2 tsp. shaoxing wine 3 dried red chili 1 tsp. garlic, minced 2 tsp. ginger, minced 2 leeks, cut in thin strips 2 tsp. hoisin sauce 2 tsp. cornstarch 4 tbsp. water Directions: - In a mixing bowl, thoroughly combine the soy sauce, sugar, Shaoxing wine, and sesame oil to mix well with each other. - Add the lamb and toss well. - Cover and set aside to marinate for 30-40 minutes. - Take a wok, set it over high heat flame and pour some peanut oil. - Heat the oil and add the minced ginger and leeks. - Cook for 1 minute. - Add the red chilies and garlic; continue to cook for another minute. - Add in the lamb and gently stir to combine well. - Cook for 8-10 minutes or until cooked through, stirring frequently. - Mix in the water, hoisin sauce, and cornstarch. - Cook for 3 minutes or until thick in consistency. - Serve warm! Nutritional Value (per serving): 362Kcal, (fats –17gr, carbs – 20gr, protein – 31gr, fiber – 3gr)

chunks.title: Spiced Duck & Rice
chunks.content: Spiced Duck & Rice Prep Time: 4 hours 15-20 min. Serves: 4-5 Ingredients: 2 tbsp. rice wine vinegar ½ cup jasmine rice, cooked ½ cup black tea leaves (optional) 2 tbs. Chinese five spice 3 duck breasts, skinless Black pepper and salt as needed ½ cup brown sugar 1 lemon rind Directions: - Season the duck with the five spice, pepper and salt. - Transfer into a Ziploc bag and pour in the vinegar. - Toss well; seal the bag and transfer to the fridge to marinate for 4 hours. - In a mixing bowl, thoroughly combine the rice, black tea leaves, sugar, and fresh lemon rind to mix well with each other. - Line the bottom of your wok with aluminum foil sheets. - Add in the rice mix and spread evenly. - Arrange a wire rack over the rice mix in the wok. - Place the duck on the wire rack. - Fold the foil to cover the duck and - Cover the wok with a lid. - Smoke for 8-10 minutes over medium heat. - Remove from the heat and continue to smoke for 2-3 minutes. - Serve warm! Nutritional Value (per serving): 357Kcal, (fats –11gr, carbs – 4gr, protein – 12gr, fiber – 3gr)

chunks.title: Hoisin Sweet Beef
chunks.content: Hoisin Sweet Beef Prep Time: 25-30 min. Serves: 5-6 Ingredients: 2 tbsp. hoisin sauce 1/ 3 cup dark brown sugar 1 cup soy sauce ¾ cup water 1 ½ tbsp. peanut oil 1 tsp. ginger, minced 2 pounds flank steak, cut to thin strips ¼ cup cornstarch 2 tbsp. garlic, minced 4 scallions, cut in small pieces Sesame seeds for garnishing Directions: - In a mixing bowl, thoroughly combine the soy sauce, water, sugar and hoisin sauce. - Stir well to mix. Set aside. - In another bowl, add the steak and cornstarch. - Toss well and set aside for 8-10 minutes. - In your wok, heat the peanut oil over medium-high flame. - Add the ginger and garlic; cook for 30-40 seconds to soften. - Add the steak; stir-fry for 2-3 minutes. - Remove and transfer to a plate. - Add the brown sugar sauce in the wok. - Add back the steak and toss well to coat evenly; cook for 1-2 minutes. - Add in the scallions, mix well. Transfer to a serving platter, sprinkle sesame seeds and serve warm. Nutritional Value (per serving): 277Kcal, (fats –9gr, carbs – 20gr, protein – 29gr, fiber – 3gr)

chunks.title: Coleslaw Pork Tortillas
chunks.content: Coleslaw Pork Tortillas Prep Time: 15 min. Serves: 4-5 Ingredients: 1 pound pork tenderloin, cut in thin strips 3 cloves garlic, minced 2 tbsp. peanut oil 2 tsp. sesame oil, lightly toasted 10 oz. coleslaw mixture 4 tbsp. hoisin sauce 6 scallions, sliced thinly 1 cup carrots, shredded 1 tbsp. soy sauce 10 flour tortillas Directions: - In your wok, heat the peanut oil over medium-high flame - Add the scallions, shredded carrots, and coleslaw mixture; fry for 2-3 minutes to soften. - Mix the hoisin and soy sauces in. - Turn the heat down to medium and add the pork. - Mix well and stir-fry for 5 minutes. - Serve warm with tortillas and sauces of your choice. Nutritional Value (per serving): 492Kcal, (fats –23gr, carbs – 38gr, protein – 31gr, fiber – 3gr)

chunks.title: Classic Garlic Broccoli Beef
chunks.content: Classic Garlic Broccoli Beef Prep Time: 15 min. Serves: 5-6 Ingredients: ¾ cup broccoli florets 1 tbsp. balsamic vinegar 1 pound beef, ground 1/4 cup yellow mustard 1 1/2 tsp. honey 1 1/2 tsp. paprika 1 tbs. garlic, minced 1 1/2 tsp. soy sauce 1/8 tsp. black pepper, ground Cooking oil as needed Directions: - Cook the broccoli florets in boiling water in a medium pan for 5-7 minutes. Set aside. - In your wok, heat some oil over medium-high flame - Add the beef; fry for 7 minutes to brown evenly, stirring constantly. - Add the mustard, paprika, vinegar, garlic, soy sauce, honey, and pepper. - Brown for 1 more minute. - Add the broccoli florets; mix gently and turn off the heat. - Transfer to serving plates and serve warm like it is or with brown rice! Nutritional Value (per serving): 492Kcal, (fats –23gr, carbs – 38gr, protein – 31gr, fiber – 3gr)

chunks.title: Veggie Hot Dog Rice
chunks.content: Veggie Hot Dog Rice Prep Time: 25-30 min. Serves: 4-5 Ingredients: 3 tbsp. cooking oil 2 eggs, beaten 3 cups steamed jasmine rice 3/4 cup peas ¾ cup carrots, diced 2 hot dog sausages, cut in quarters lengthwise & sliced 1 1/2 tbsp. soy sauce 1/8 tsp. pepper, ground 1/4 tsp. salt 4 green onions, thinly sliced Directions: - In your wok, heat 2 tbsp oil over medium-high flame. - Add the beaten eggs, salt, and pepper cook to evenly scramble and set aside. - In the wok, add the hot dog sausages and cook for 2 minutes. - Add the remaining oil, rice and stir for 2 minutes. - Add the peas and carrots, soy sauce, green onions, and scrambled eggs; stir-fry for about 2-3 minutes. - Serve warm with sausage on top! Nutritional Value (per serving): 585Kcal, (fats –19gr, carbs – 56gr, protein – 17gr, fiber – 6gr)

chunks.title: Chapter 4: Exotic Noodle Recipes
chunks.content: Chapter 4: Exotic Noodle Recipes Shrimp Egg Noodles Prep Time: 35-40 min. Serves: 4-5 Ingredients: 1 tbsp. soy sauce 1 tbsp. oyster sauce 1 tbsp. shaoxing wine 1 tsp. white sugar 1 onion, thinly sliced 1 clove garlic, minced 1 tsp. sesame oil 2 tbsp. peanut oil 1 red bell pepper, cut in strips 10 oz. rice noodles, soaked until softened and drained 1 scallion, sliced 1 cup shrimp, sliced thinly 2 eggs, beaten Directions: - In a mixing bowl, thoroughly combine the wine, white sugar, soy sauce, sesame oil, and oyster sauce. Set aside. - In your wok, heat the oil over medium-high flame. - Add the chopped onion, garlic, and red bell pepper; brown for 30 seconds. - Add the shrimp and fry for 1-2 minutes constantly stirring. - Add the eggs and cook for 1 more minute. - Add the drained noodles; toss and fry for 2 minutes. - Add the sauce; toss and cook for 2 minutes. - Add the scallions and cook for 1 minute. - Serve warm! Nutritional Value (per serving): 184Kcal, (fats –12gr, carbs – 11gr, protein – 12gr, fiber – 6gr)

chunks.title: Vegetarian Mushroom Noodles
chunks.content: Vegetarian Mushroom Noodles Prep Time: 30-35 min. Serves: 4-5 Ingredients: 1 tsp. sesame oil 1 tsp. chili sauce 1 tbsp. peanut oil 2 tbsp. soy sauce 2 tsp. white sugar 2 cloves garlic, minced ¼ cup carrots, shredded ½ cup snow peas 2 scallions, cut in small pieces ½ pound lo-mein noodles 1 ½ cups cremini mushrooms, thinly sliced 1 julienned red bell pepper Directions: - Cook the noodles for 8-10 minutes in salted water in a pot; drain and set aside. - In a mixing bowl, thoroughly combine the soy sauce, white sugar, sesame oil, and chili sauce. Set aside. - In your wok, heat the oil over medium-high flame. - Add the garlic, mushrooms, bell pepper, and carrots. Stir well to mix. - Cook for 3-5 minutes or until the mushrooms turn soft. - Add the peas and scallions. - Stir well; cook for another 2-3 minutes. - Mix in the noodles and sauce. Toss well until evenly coated. - Cook for 1 more minute and serve warm! Nutritional Value (per serving): 376Kcal, (fats –13gr, carbs – 36gr, protein – 15gr, fiber – 7gr)

chunks.title: Pancetta Peas Noodles
chunks.content: Pancetta Peas Noodles Prep Time: 18-20 min. Serves: 4-5 Ingredients: 1/2 cup grated parmesan 1 tbsp. olive oil 3 oz. pack ramen noodles (flavor packet discarded) 3 cups low-sodium chicken broth 1 tbsp. butter 1 medium onion, chopped 1/4 tsp. salt 1/2 cup diced pancetta 10 oz. frozen peas 1/4 tsp. ground black pepper Directions: - In your wok, heat the oil over medium flame. - Add and cook the pancetta for 4-5 minutes, stirring occasionally. - Stir in the onion and salt; cook for 3-4 minutes, stirring in between. - Add the noodles and cook for 1 minute, stirring constantly. - Mix in the peas and broth; turn the heat to high and bring to a boil. - Cook for about 3 more minutes, stirring constantly. - Turn off the heat and stir in the butter, Parmesan, and pepper. - Serve warm! Nutritional Value (per serving): 558Kcal, (fats –6gr, carbs – 85gr, protein – 30gr, fiber – 6gr)

chunks.title: Broccoli Pineapple Pasta
chunks.content: Broccoli Pineapple Pasta Prep Time: 20-25 min. Serves: 7-8 Ingredients: 3 cups cooked chicken breasts, cut in strips 2 cups frozen sweet pepper stir-fry 1 cup broccoli florets, boiled 2/3 cup stir-fry sauce 2 cups pineapple chunks 2 tbsp. vegetable oil 1 pound linguine pasta Directions: - Take a pan and pour 4 cups of water, boil the water and add the chicken strips. Boil for 10 minutes. - Cook the pasta in salted water, as per the package instructions. - Drain and set aside. - Heat your wok on a medium-high heat. - Pour the oil and heat it. Add the boiled broccoli florets and pineapples and cook for 2-3 minutes. - Stir in the pepper and fry for 2-3 more minutes; stirring in between. - Mix in the chicken and the sauce and brown for 2-3 minutes. - Serve warm with the cooked pasta. Nutritional Value (per serving): 368Kcal, (fats –8gr, carbs – 43gr, protein – 23gr, fiber – 5gr)

chunks.title: Chapter 5: Fresh Vegetarian Recipes
chunks.content: Chapter 5: Fresh Vegetarian Recipes Teriyaki Ginger Green Beans Prep Time: 15 min. Serves: 3-4 Ingredients: 1 tbsp. ginger root, minced 1 tbsp. garlic, minced 1/2 cup + 3 tbsp. peanut oil to fry 1 pound green beans, trimmed and cut in 2-inch pieces 1/2 tsp. white sugar 1 1/2 tsp. teriyaki sauce 1 pinch black pepper Directions: - In your wok; heat the peanut oil over medium-high flame. - Add the beans; cook the beans for 2-3 minutes to soften. Set aside. - Add more oil to the wok (about 3 tbsp) and heat it again. - Add the garlic and ginger; cook for 2 minutes to brown. - Add the beans back in the wok; mix the black pepper, sugar, and teriyaki. - Cook everything for about 1 minute and serve warm! Nutritional Value (per serving): 60Kcal, (fats –2gr, carbs – 9gr, protein – 3gr, fiber – 3gr)

Set aside. - Add more oil to the wok (about 3 tbsp) and heat it again. - Add the garlic and ginger; cook for 2 minutes to brown. - Add the beans back in the wok; mix the black pepper, sugar, and teriyaki. - Cook everything for about 1 minute and serve warm! Nutritional Value (per serving): 60Kcal, (fats –2gr, carbs – 9gr, protein – 3gr, fiber – 3gr)

chunks.title: Asian Soy Eggplants
chunks.content: Asian Soy Eggplants Prep Time: 35 min. Serves: 4-6 Ingredients: 4 tbsp. vegetable oil, divided 2 onions, thinly sliced 4 eggplants, cut in 1-inch cubes 2 tbsp. water 1 1/2 tbsp. oyster sauce 1 tbsp. chili garlic sauce 1 tbsp. minced garlic 2 tbsp. soy sauce 1 tsp. white sugar Ground black pepper as needed 1/2 tsp. sesame oil Directions: - In a mixing bowl, mix the pepper, soy sauce, sugar, water, chili sauce, and oyster sauce. - In your wok; heat 2 tbsp. of oil over medium-high flame. - Add the eggplants and stir-fry for 5-6 minutes. Set aside. - Add 2 more tbsp. oil in the wok. - Add the onions and garlic; cook for 1 minute to soften. - Pour the soy sauce mix and eggplants; simmer the mix over medium flame for 4-5 minutes, stirring constantly. - Add some sesame oil and cook for 1 more minute. - Top with some chopped scallions, if desired. Nutritional Value (per serving): 78Kcal, (fats –3gr, carbs – 1gr, protein – 2gr, fiber – 5gr)

chunks.title: Spiced Bean Mania
chunks.content: Spiced Bean Mania Prep Time: 35-40 min. Serves: 7-8 Ingredients: 2 cloves garlic, minced 2 tsp. ginger root, chopped 1 tsp. cayenne pepper 1 tsp. ground turmeric 2 tbsp. vegetable oil 2 onions, minced 1 tsp. ground coriander 2 (2 inch) sticks cinnamon, crushed 1 tsp. ground cumin Salt as needed 2 (15 oz.) cans garbanzo beans 1 cup cilantro, chopped Directions: - Heat your wok over medium heat, pour some oil to heat. - Add the onions; cook until they are tender for about 1-2 minutes. - Mix in the turmeric, salt, cayenne, garlic, cinnamon, cumin, ginger, and coriander. - Cook for 1-2 minutes; stirring in between. - Mix in the beans and liquid from the cans. - Cook the mixture, for 4-5 minutes, until the liquid is evaporated and the sauce is thick. - Top with cilantro and serve. Nutritional Value (per serving): 60Kcal, (fats –4gr, carbs – 8gr, protein – 4gr, fiber – 5gr)

chunks.title: Peanut Veggie Stir Fry
chunks.content: Peanut Veggie Stir Fry Prep Time: 10-15 min. Serves: 5-6 Ingredients: 2 tsp. garlic powder 2 tsp. peanut butter 2 tbsp. soy sauce 1 tbsp. brown sugar 2 tsp. olive oil 2 cups frozen vegetables mix (carrots, bell peppers, eggplants and etc) Directions: - In a mixing bowl, mix the peanut butter, say sauce, garlic powder, and sugar. - Take your wok and heat some oil in it over medium heat. - Add and stir-fry the veggies for 7-8 minutes. - Season the veggies with the soy sauce mix, toss well and fry for 1 more minute. - Serve warm! Nutritional Value (per serving): 176Kcal, (fats –6gr, carbs – 15gr, protein – 12gr, fiber – 6gr)

chunks.title: Mushroom Sprouts Rice
chunks.content: Mushroom Sprouts Rice Prep Time: 15-20 min. Serves: 3-4 Ingredients: 1 cup zucchini, shred to make matchsticks 1/2 (14 oz.) can bean sprouts, drained 2 tbsp. sesame oil 1 cup carrots, shred to make matchsticks 1 (4.5 oz.) can sliced mushrooms, drained 1/8 tsp. salt 2 tbsp. soy sauce 2 cups cooked rice 1/3 cup sliced green onions 1/4 tsp. ground black pepper 3 tsp. sweet red chili sauce Directions: - In your wok, stir-fry the zucchini and carrots in sesame oil for 5 minutes. - Add the mushrooms and sprouts. - Cook for 5 more minutes and add some salt. - Combine and remove the veggies from the wok. Set aside. - In the wok, add the pepper, soy sauce, and green onions. - Add the chili sauce and cook until the mix turns hot. - Pour the soy sauce mix over the veggies and stir well to combine. - Serve warm along with the cooked rice. Nutritional Value (per serving): 152Kcal, (fats –9gr, carbs – 16gr, protein – 12gr, fiber – 6gr)

chunks.title: Conclusion
chunks.content: Conclusion Wok is a healthy way of cooking and enjoying your favorite meals. It is quite easy to use and clean and takes less time of yours to invest in your kitchen chores. In addition, wok meals look pretty festive and exotic, so you can make these recipes for your special gatherings, holiday parties and formal get-to-gather events. Guests just love being served with delicious stir-fried dishes to fill their stomachs and hearts. I sincerely hope that the book has succeeded in its mission to give all the readers a truly versatile collection of wok recipes to easily prepare at home and enjoy these flavor-rich, healthy wok meals with your family and loved ones. Wok cooking is so popular due to the creative style of preparing and arranging the ingredients, as well as the flexibility and modifications. So don’t be afraid of culinary experiments, be creative and add your favorite ingredients to these recipes to make your own customized versions. Finally, if you have enjoyed the Wonder Wok Cookbook, I would appreciate it if you spend a few minutes of your valuable time to share your views and suggestion in a short review. Have a great time making these healthy wok recipes. Share more and bring more smiles. Best Regards, Eric Davis
